metadata.title: CVE-2015-6676 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in Adobe Flash Player before 18.0.0.241 and 19.x before19.0.0.185 on Windows and OS X and before 11.2.202.521 on Linux, Adobe AIRbefore 19.0.0.190, Adobe AIR SDK before 19.0.0.190, and Adobe AIR SDK &Compiler before 19.0.0.190 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code viaunspecified vectors, a different vulnerability than CVE-2015-6678.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

flashplugin-downloader - 11.2.202.521ubuntu0.14.04.1
flashplugin-installer - 11.2.202.521ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: flashplugin-nonfree package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '11.2.202.521ubuntu0.14.04.1').
